name: TheAtlantic
text: Embracing marijuana legalization could be an easy win for Joe Biden. But he remains reluctant, @IsaacDovere reports. https://t.co/PzbAFJUhuJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: It‚Äôs hardly a stretch to say that hundreds of millions, perhaps billions, of wild animals will ultimately be spared from becoming roadkill because of coronavirus lockdowns, @ben_a_goldfarb reports: https://t.co/pvhOivzjuN

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In recent weeks, the protests over the killing of George Floyd have provoked an unusually wide-ranging debate about how to respond to police violence. Earmark funds for reform? Defund the police? Abolish them?" @conor64 writes: https://t.co/CBqE4YT5qT

name: TheAtlantic
text: The United States is breaking coronavirus-case records weekly. Americans should avoid faulting the wrong people, our writers warn. From @mimbsy: https://t.co/rOvUaeMEPE

text: RT @edyong209: üö®I wrote about the mental and emotional toll that the pandemic is taking on public health experts, who‚Äôve been running on fumes for months, and who are deeply frustrated with shouting empirical advice into a political void. 1/ https://t.co/BGmsfuldMO

text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I always feel like I'm never doing enough." America's public-health experts are tired, drained, and frustrated about shouting advice into a political void, @edyong209 reports. https://t.co/XlOwd0JmgN

text:

text: RT @marinakoren: "Her phone is now a miserable metronome, ticking out the rhythm of the pandemic ever more rapidly as Arizona‚Äôs cases climb. 'It has almost become white noise.'" https://t.co/ONC3k7sPjy from @edyong209

text: "The argument is not based on any programmatic promises or some kind of policy agenda for a second term in office," @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/pe7VzX67aO

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump captured the White House with a campaign based on racial backlash, and now, after nearly four years of racist remarks and appeals, backlash to the backlash may doom his campaign," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/G0df9eCr73

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has described the coronavirus as a ‚Äúlittle flu,‚Äù accused the media of manufacturing ‚Äúhysteria,‚Äù and railed against lockdowns, @UriLF reported in March.

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: A wave of psychological stress unique in its nature and proportions is bearing down on an already-ramshackle American mental-health-care system, @jdkstern13 reports. And as one expert put it, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre very well prepared at all.‚Äù https://t.co/bdyGtNJNbJ

text: RT @YAppelbaum: Mary Trump‚Äôs claim that her uncle hired someone to take the SAT for him has me thinking back to this astonishing, luminous @CaitlinPacific essay on the college-cheating scandal. name: TheAtlantic
text: The luxury fashion industry is built on the hierarchies of classism and racism. @amandamull explores what it would take for fashion to survive without them. https://t.co/k1ptgOQLU1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pop Smoke‚Äôs posthumous debut album soundtracks the unthinkable‚Äîa New York summer without rowdy social gatherings, and a rap landscape without the late musician, @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/wcwWVp5mcI

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: The fashion industry is built on the emotional scaffolding of human aspiration as imagined by rich Europeans‚Äîit's a monument to whiteness and unearned wealth. I wrote about whether that kind of industry can move forward from this moment. https://t.co/WXwln3AEOl

name: TheAtlantic
text:

And yes! I agree! Consider this the latest in an unofficial series... 1/
